sub_title: Business, Strategy and (Social) Innovation Consultant | 2x TEDx Speaker | Ex-Entrepreneur | Mentor | Female Empowerment Agent
summary:
I am a goal-oriented and entrepreneurial-minded professional with a passion for innovation and a track record of success in providing evidence-based, data-driven strategic insights. My experience is in developing social-impact business models and tech-based solutions. I have honed my skills in strategic and analytical thinking, allowing me to identify opportunities for growth and lead effective implementation efforts.

Having grown up in Syria and experienced the first 12 years of war, I learned how to operate in challenging and rapidly changing environments. As the founder and CEO of ChangeMakers, I leveraged my entrepreneurial skills to create impactful programs focused on women's empowerment and community prosperity. This experience allowed me to develop a competitive and agile skillset, while also building my network with world shapers worldwide.

I am particularly interested in pursuing a career trajectory in strategy and innovation, leveraging my experience and skills to drive meaningful change in the global industry. My ability to manage multiple stakeholders and complex projects, as well as my passion for innovation and technology, prepare me very well to drive growth and impact.

My achievements have been recognized by publications such as Forbes, Wamda, and the national website of the Government of The Netherlands. I look forward to connecting with others who share my passion for using innovation and technology to create positive change. You are always invited to reach out at peace.nukta@gmail.com to discuss opportunities for collaboration or grab a virtual coffee over the topics that we have in common.

profile_positions.description:
The Justice Accelerator (JA) has been HiiL’s flagship programme for justice startups for the past 10 years. The programme has an experienced team with The Hague based experts and regional hubs to fund, train and coach startups towards impact across West Africa, East Africa (incl Uganda), Southern Africa, MENA, and Ukraine.
Key Responsabilities:
- Facilitating the execution of the JA program via utilizing project management skills and optimizing the use of technology and software’s, such as ClickUp and Google Workspace, to ensure a smooth workflow of tasks across teams.
- Measuring and reporting social impact using data and analytics, via AirTable, to identify opportunities for improvement and to communicate the company's social impact to stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer Global Justice Accelerator Program

profile_positions.description:
Warsha ( و ر شة ) is an Arabic word which translates to the “Workshop” in English. Warsha is a Netherlands-based consultancy startup (KVK 82302448) that strives for youth development and empowerment through entrepreneurship, technology, and innovation. Warsha's mission is to help organizations and global socially responsible corporations contribute to youth empowerment worldwide by enabling more education and employment opportunities. Its vision is to create a world with equal opportunities for all.

Warsha aims to assist organizations and corporations in the West by providing them with research-based consultancy services to develop empowerment programs that are tailored for young people in the Middle East, with a special focus on cultural sensitivity and female participation. Given our extended experience of the region, knowledge of culture and language as well as access to grassroots communities, we ensure that no one is left behind and that the desired positive impact is well achieved.

In 2022:
In partnership with Seeds For The Future, Huawei's global CSR flagship program, and Purpose in Motion, I was privileged to work with 35+ enthusiastic teams worldwide who analyzed and developed socially impactful business models. In my capacity as their mentor, we worked together to address global issues and develop tech-based and innovative solutions.

In 2021:
- Warsha signed an SBIR contract with the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs to investigate the education and employment needs of young people in Jordan. The 6-month research project included the development of a thorough project plan to tackle the education-to-market gap there via digital solutions. The final report reflected on opportunities and threats for the suggested solution, analysis of stakeholders, and development of business and revenue models. It has quickly acquired attention from global leading stakeholders, such as SPARK NGO, Google and the UN.
profile_positions.title: Business and Innovation Consultant - Founder

profile_positions.description:
The dynamic position enabled me to work and coordinate between various departments at the organization, interact closely with the board and leadership team as well as engage with +500 scholars and prestigious university partners.

Key responsibilities and achievements were:
- Aligned the program's strategy with the organization's overall vision and ensured documentation for organizational learning purposes.
- Built Relationships with 3+ Program Partners and 3+ universities globally.
- Oversaw the program's financial payments.
- Onboarded 30+ new scholars at globally recognized universities, including designing and implementing a competitive selection process.
- Managed progress and donor reporting, including data collection and editing.
- Led coordination for program communications, including the website updates.
- Established a strong alumni network and engaged with 500+ scholars globally, at a 100% alumni engagement rate.
profile_positions.title: Scholarship Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
ChangeMakers is a social enterprise born from the heart of Damascus, Syria, aiming to teach the youth the principles of programming and improve their ability to communicate effectively. ChangeMakers seeks to bridge the gap in school education by adapting convenient curriculum and interactive teaching while also reduce the gender gap in the tech field.

ChangeMakers played a great role in achieving Quality Education (SDG4) and Gender Equality (SDG5) in Syria and was recognized as a market leader in tech empowerment for youth by several stakeholders, including the UN, The Dutch Government and by testimonies of our participants.

•	Lead a team of 15+ online and offline motivated young people.
•	Ensure strategy alignment with vision and objectives while developing strategies and plans.
•	Oversee the mobilization of funds.
•	Develop and sustain strong relations with national and international partners.
•	Represent ChangeMakers in international events and ensure well visibility in conferences and various media outlets. 
•	Organize ChangeMakers’s Innovation Bootcamps impacting 50+ young people, Hackathons producing 15+ tech and web-based projects.
•	Facilitate the implementation of ChangeMakers’s meetups impacting +1,000 young programmers and university students.
profile_positions.title: Startup Growth Officer - Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Orange Corners is an initiative of the Kingdom of The Netherlands that provides young entrepreneurs across Africa and the Middle East with the necessary training, mentorship, network, funding and facilities to start and grow their businesses. Specific focus is given to entrepreneurs creating innovative and sustainable solutions to local challenges and contributing to the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

During my 6-month internship at Orange Corners, I conducted a research-based strategy aiming to improve their expansion of activities in the Middle East. In my research, I focused on analyzing challenges and barriers which young people in the Middle East face when they aspire to become entrepreneurs based on pre-existing literature and inspired by the group discussions I had with young entrepreneurs in the region. The resilience and determination which young people in conflict zones develop inspired me. My 5+ years of personal experience in entrepreneurship in Syria allowed me to reflect on the academic findings I was able to learn during my internship which strengthened my strategy recommendations and allowed me to thrive in strategizing and development.
profile_positions.title: Program Assistant - Orange Corners

profile_positions.description:
LeafUp offers memberships to invest in coffee farms allowing ethical coffee drinkers to fight poverty, support the farmer, protect our planet earth and get discounts at the best coffee shops! At LeafUp, we pay farmers a living wage to plant fruit and hardwood trees on coffee farms. 

In the past several decades, millions of trees have been lost to make room for mono-culture coffee.  If this continues, the environment will suffer, more birds will lose their habitats and more chemical pesticides will be used which will have major impacts on everyone’s lives, in addition to damaging the soil which will result in low quality coffee.

LeafUp is turning things around by letting coffee drinkers pay for planting trees, save money in return through cool discounts, protect the environment, and empower the farmer.

* Honored to had worked on this remotely with an amazing team from Morocco, The US, Algeria and Tanzania. LeafUp is founded in partnership with Yara International and as part of YSI Innovation Program, which brings together top young talent from across the globe. With over 12k applicants and space for only 27 participants each year, it's an incredibly selective, and incredibly awesome, program. A video intro to our team is below.
profile_positions.title: Market Analyst - Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Working with a team of national and international experts seeking to develop efficient and timely donor reports, research and information gathering to contribute to the developing of funding proposals. The reporting team is responsible for capturing UNFPA’s programmatic successes and key achievements.

•	Establish an effective reporting and reports tracking system for donor reports.
•	Monitor deadlines while ensuring that reporting requirements (frequency, quality, capacity and timeliness) for all running activities have been planned and agreed upon.
•	Support the Drafting of data for periodic presentations and meetings with 10+ donors.
•	Produce accurate, regular and timely narrative reports in English (ensure an Arabic version is available when needed).
•	Support the coordination of statistics, maps and photos in reports in collaboration with Country Office and regional communication and reporting staff.
•	Gather and analyze of information on potential donors and preparation of donors’ profiles.
•	Facilitate knowledge building and information sharing by providing support and training for the reporting focal points of implementing partners.
•	Produce human interest stories for various outlets, such as website, newspapers and different social media channels.
profile_positions.title: National United Nations Youth Volunteer - Reporting Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Working with a dedicated team of national professionals to develop communication plans to strengthen public’s understanding of UNFPA mission and objectives, enhancing organization’s credibility as well as to provide effective and timely professional assistance and support in developing, drafting and maintaining contacts’ information, relations with media and maintaining publications materials.

•	Write and edit 150+ human interest stories for various outlets and media purposes.
•	Create social media visibility content and assist in the development and implementation of the organization’s communication strategy.
•	Organize 50+ youth events and national campaigns impacting 50,000+ youth.
profile_positions.title: Communication Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Jusoor is a US 501c3 NGO organization of Syrian expatriates supporting the country’s development and helping Syrian youth realize their potential through programs in the fields of education, career development, and global community engagement. It is a detail-oriented, confidential role, requiring superb organizational skills, accuracy, and team-work and collaboration across multiple departments of the organization.

- Record day-to-day financial transaction in the organization’s financial software (QuickBooks) overseeing around 5,000+ transactions
- Prepare monthly financial statement and reports.
- Track expenditure of program-locked donations.
- Ensure compliance to legal requirements.
- Keep and organize financial documents.
profile_positions.title: Bookkeeper

profile_positions.description:
Lead the Academic Mentorship Program which offers academic advice to Syrian students requiring help in their university application processes and seeking more information on academic choices and studying abroad. The program is focused on connecting expatriate Syrians and volunteers with highly ambitious students in Syria and those recently displaced to provide coaching and mentoring throughout their academic life.

- Select mentees and mentors to participate and hold interviews as needed.
- Match mentees and mentors and following-up with them.
- Lead lectures series, which includes inviting mentors to lead sessions, host and publicize the sessions.
- Oversee the webpage of the mentorship program online.
- Report on the status of the program and evaluate its success and areas for improvement.
profile_positions.title: Academic Mentorship Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.role: Advisor to the Policy and Drafting Committee - Youth Task Force
volunteer_experiences.description:
The Youth Task Force consists of 30 young people from broad youth-led global networks and
organisations and civic movements and has a key role to play in advising the UN Women in making their work more inclusive to young people. The Youth task Force will work closely to the UN Women on a voluntary basis to ensure that young people are mobilized, engaged and contribute to all stages and aspects of the global review processes.
Their main aim will be to offer guidance and support to UN Women’s efforts to ensure the meaningful
engagement of youth in Beijing+25 review processes focusing on the 64th session of the UN Commission on the Status of Women, the Global Forum for Gender Equality and the 75th session of the General Assembly.
The youth Task Force is a diverse group and inclusive to all inter-sectional complexities including marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, indigenous and ethnic identities, and refugee or migrant status.

volunteer_experiences.role: Young Ambassador | Enterprise for Peace Scholarship
volunteer_experiences.description: I have been chosen as a One Young World delegate who has demonstrated leadership ability and a commitment to effecting positive change. Delegates graduate as One Young World Ambassadors, joining a network of young leaders who are creating positive change around the world.

volunteer_experiences.role: Youth Advisor at the Gender Innovation Agora - GIA
volunteer_experiences.description: The UN Women Regional Office for Arab States (ROAS) established the Youth Gender Innovation Agora (GIA) as a consultative forum and a platform for regular dialogue with youth. The GIA is constituted from among eminent civil society professionals, young activists, and advocacy & social media influencers to support the youth representatives to develop innovative gender equality solutions and engage with a broader range of stakeholders. The GIA members are appointed with the task to provide expertise on youth and gender issues, encourage the mobilization of young people and facilitate the dissemination of information to networks and organizations around the region.

The Global Education Monitoring Report is an editorially independent, authoritative and evidence-based annual report published by UNESCO. Its mandate is to monitor progress towards the education targets in the new Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) framework. The substance of the GEM Report is developed and its quality assured by an experienced team under the leadership of the GEM Report Director.

•	Lead youth digital events, which includes hosting and publicizing the sessions.
•	Contribute media materials, which includes blog posts and reports foreword.
•	Assist in outreaching youth and organizing youth events.

•	Translate scientific papers and recently published reports.
•	Coordinate scientific articles and papers with the translation team.
•	Work with a team of 500+ members, and coordinate between members of the “Biology and Evolution” and “Sexual Education” sub groups to present to our followers.
